bboxes.raw_text:
Lonnie Lee Landrum. 40, of
722 S. Third Ave., was acquitted
of murder in the fatal shooting
Oct. ii Of Albert Evans, 81.


A Superior Court jury returned
the verdict to Judge W. E. Patter-
son after celebrating six hours.


The shooting occurred in a
vacant lot at 1909 w. Buckeye.

lowed Powell to Puerto Rico,
where he has a plush home, and
charged that he illegally trans
ferred his property to the name
of his wife's uncle to escape
payment. The charge resulted in
the warrant for his arrest &C
cusing him of fraud.


Powell said he surrendered
himself to Jose Perez Rodri-
guez, Rio Piedras district Judge.


The congressman was cited for
contempt of court in New York
because he refused to show up for
a hearing to have his records
examined. The Judge ordered his
arrest, but said the warrant would
be held up while Congress is in
session,

SAN JAUN, PR. = Rep. Adam
Clayton Powell surrendered to
police in connection with a fraud
warrant and was released when
he promised he would appear for
trial.


The warrant for his arrest was
obtained by Mrs. Esther James
Ct, a Harlem widow who won
$46,5O0 libel judgment against the
New York Democratic congress-
man when he accused her on a
television program of being a
"bag woman" or graft-collector,
for the police department.


Mrs. James has been trying to
collect for nearly year. She fol-

l. How would you vote on Constitutional
amendment to permit voluntary prayer
in public schools7
2. How would you vote on the idea Of paying
for medical care of the aged through the
Social Security system7
8. In the Civil Rights Bill. which passed
the House, there are ten titles considered
to be controversial. Please check how
you would vote on each.


a. VOTING: strengthens previous laws;
calls for standardized literacy tests
for federal elections: sixth grade edu-
cation is evidence of literacy.
b. PUBLIC ACCOMMODATIONS: no dis
elimination by any establishment or
service that has ANY contact with in
terstate commerce.


c. PUBLIC FACILITIES: permits the Gov
eminent to file suit and argue cases,
on complaint. Of discrimination in any
publicly owned facilities.
d. EDUCATION The Attorney General can
file suits to force desegregation: auth
orizes aid to communities that are try
ing to desegregate


e. CIVIL RIGHTS COMMISSION: continues
the present Commission for four more
years: prohibits 1t from investigating
the policies Of private groups.
+. FEDERAL AID: prohibits discrimina-
ton in distributing federal aid. Agen-
cies may cut off aid only after hearings,
court review, notifying Congress, and
receiving Presidential approval.
6. EMPLOYMENT: prohibits discrimina-
tion by PRIVATE employers and unions
on the basis of race or sex. Non-em-
ployment of atheists and Communists is
not considered discrimination.
h. VOTING CENSUS: directs the Census
Bureau to take census of voters by
race in areas designated by the Civil
Rights Commission. This could lead to
reducing representation In the House
by invoking the 18th Amendment.
1. REMAND: permits appeal, on Federal
Court order that refuses to take Civil
Rights case out of State Court even
though such appeals are not permitted
In other legal cases.
J. CANCELLATION: establishes commun-
ity relations and Cancellation service
in the Commerce Department to con-
ciliate racial disputes.
k. How would you vote on the whole bill7
4. In regard to Cuba. would you:
a. Resume diplomatic relations to try to
win her over7


b. Go on trying to persuade others not to
trade with herr


c. Go on trying to persuade others not
to trade with herr
C. Put on a blockade against strategic
materials only7


d. Put on blocade against any COM
merce in any materials7
e. Organize Cuban emigre army and
support an invasion2
I. Use all conventional sources neces-
sary to GUST Castro7
S. In regard to Panama, would you:
a. Insist on strict enforcement of the
1908 Treay7


b. Agree to renegotiate the entire Treaty.
c.lAgree to renegotiate payments to Pan
ama7


d. Agree to a partnership arrangement
with Panama.


e. Have the u S. build new sea level canal7
6. In respect to Wet Nam, do you believe
we should:


A. Get out7


b. Continue our support at the present rate7
c. Increase our support
d. Strike at the bases in North Wet Nam
used to supply the Wet Cong7
7. When a nation expropriates American
property and holdings, should we:

When busting cake pans for
chocolate cakes, use cocoa instead
of flour. Result-no white parti-
cles clinging to your finished
masterpiece.


4 :: 4


You can remove the layer of
starch collected on the bottom of
your iron with baking soda. APP
ply the soda to your cold iron
with lightly dampened cloth or
sponge.

a. Intervene militarily to satisfy our


claims7


b. Use all diplomatic channels to firml,


insist on payment


c. Deny the nation all foreign aid until


payment is nader
8. In regard to the North Atlantic Treaty
Organization, do you think we should:
a. Abandon III


b. Strengthen It by dealing with the Soviets


only after we have NATO approval
c. Increase economic ties through NATO


Common Market7


d. Continue our present policy7
9. AS to trade with Communist nations,
would you believe:


a. 1t should be done only for dollars or
gold7


b. 1t should be done on the basis of loans
and credits, as with our allies7
c. Not at all7
10. Since 1860. do you feel the US. pres
tige in the world:


a. Has increased7


b. Has decreased7
c. Has not changed?
IL. How do you feel in regard to disarm-
ament:


a. 1t would be a mistake to consider
disarmament at this time.
b. Universal disarmament should begin
but be done in stages, with thorough
inspection and control.
C. The US. should begin disarming re-
CARELESS Of others, as an example to
to the rest of the world.
IL. In regard to unemployment, do you be-
heve the federal government should:
a. Assume full responsibility for solving
the problem7
b. Share the responsibility with the states
and free enterprise7
C. Allow the states and free enterprise
to solve the problem7
Is. How would you vote on establishing
Job corps with work-training camps
throughout the country
IA. Should a domestic "Peace Corps be
established to provide training and SER
vices upon local request7
Is. How would you vote on federally sub
sidized retraining program for people
whose skills have become or will be-
come outdated7
l6. Generally speaking, would you consider
yourself:
a.A Liberal
b. A CONSERVATIVE
c. An Independent
II. To help analyze the results of this survey,
please check one:
IL. In terms of age, are you:
a. Under 302
b. From 80 457
c. From As 607
d. Over 607
